Projects

You will find detailed documentation of my engineering/research work, including presentations, media, and downloadable resources.

Bioinstrumentation

Electronics, sensors, and hardware instrumentation projects.

Laser Microphone

Feb 2026 - Present | Work in Progress

Senior project to image inside tissue using laser light and sound. Reconstructing photo-acoustic signals in tissue phantom by observing interferometry changes from a reflected laser beam.

Biophotonics Microcontrollers Signal Processing
View Details

WiFi-RF Sensing Project

Jan 2026 - Present | Work in Progress

Personal project to detect movement and presence in any room with WiFi. Developing wireless sensing capabilities from ESP32 IoT microcontrollers for RF-based imaging applications.

ESP32 IoT Wireless Sensing
View Details

Analog Hearing Aid

Aug - Dec 2023 | Duke University

Designed a low-cost hearing aid prototype (<$30), achieving <2% harmonic distortion, 55× gain, and 4.4/5 speech intelligibility. Multi-stage analog hearing aid circuit with dynamic range compression and bandpass filtering, validated with audio testing and user feedback.

Analog Electronics Filter Design MATLAB
View Details

Photoplethysmography (PPG)

Aug - Dec 2023 | Duke University

Built a blood oxygen and heart rate monitor matching commercial performance. Prototyped a breadboard implementation of a clinical PPG device for optical heart rate and blood volume measurement.

Analog Electronics Optical Sensing Biomedical
View Details

Electromyography (EMG)

Jan - May 2024 | Duke University

Built a circuit to sense muscle activation. Designed an analog EMG front-end with instrumentation amplifiers and bandpass filtering for muscle signal acquisition.

Analog Electronics Signal Processing Biomedical
View Details

ALS Assistive Feeding System

Aug - Dec 2021 | Duke University

Designed a motorized pulley system with Arduino controls enabling ALS patients to independently manage tube feeding.

Arduino Assistive Tech Prototyping
View Details

ML & Modeling

Machine learning, data analytics, and computational research projects.

Scalable ML for Antibiotic Screening

Aug - Dec 2025 | Duke University

Set up a workflow for drug discovery using newly published industry ML model (GNEprop, Genetech 2025). Benchmarked GNEprop against Chemprop and XGBoost on 2,560 antibiotic candidates, achieving ROC-AUC 0.936 with robust ML validation.

Machine Learning Drug Discovery Python
View Details

Systems Modeling of Gene-Circuit Biosensors

Aug - Dec 2025 | Duke University

Modeled a biosensor for potential environmental toxin detection. Developed ODE-based biosensor models in Python to infer toxin concentration from bioluminescent data with quantified uncertainty.

Python ODE Modeling Biosensors
View Details

Data Analytics Project w/ Arts NC

Jan - Apr 2025 | Arts North Carolina

Helped legislature support in NC government organization using data analytics. Produced legislative research supporting NC Bill H418, analyzing arts education impact across 4 state/federal datasets for 150+ legislators.

Data Analytics Machine Learning Policy Research
View Details

Independent Study w/ Michael Lynch Lab

Jan - Aug 2023 | Duke University

Built an automated in silico screening pipeline for antibiotic analogues, increasing molecular simulation throughput by ~100×.

Python AlphaFold Molecular Dynamics
View Details

Software

Simulations, mobile apps, and software development projects.

Monte Carlo Simulation of Light

Feb 2026 | Duke University

Computer simulation mockup for light research. Monte Carlo simulation of light photons through biological tissue, modeling light scattering and absorption.

Python Monte Carlo Optics
View Details

App for Wearable Blood Alcohol Monitor

Aug - Dec 2023 | Duke University

Built iOS/Android apps for real-time BAC monitoring with Bluetooth connectivity to a microcontroller. Used Google's Flutter framework to develop cross-platform mobile applications for a wearable breathalyzer device.

Embedded Systems Bluetooth Zephyr RTOS
View Details

UChat

Aug - Dec 2023 | Duke University

Anonymous 1-on-1 chat app for university students to connect by shared hobbies. Cross-platform mobile app built with React Native and Firebase for real-time messaging within a campus community.

React Native Firebase TypeScript Mobile App
